gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਕਰਪੂਰ ਲੋਨ ੲੇਕ ਸੇ ਦਿਖਾੲੀ ਦੇਤ ਕੇਸਰ ਕਸੁੰਭ ਸਮਸਰ ਅਰੁਨਾੲੀ ਕੈ
transliteration: Jaisay Karapoor Lon Ayk Say Dikhaaee Dayta , Kaysar Kasounbh Samasar Arounaaee Kai ?
translation: Just as a camphor and salt being white look alike, petals of saffron and safflower (Carthamus tinctorious) being red, look the same.

gurmukhi: ਰੂਪੋ ਕਾਂਸੀ ਦੋਨੋ ਜੈਸੇ ੳੂਜਲ ਬਰਨ ਹੋਤ ਕਾਜਰ ਅੌ ਚੋਅਾ ਹੈ ਸਮਾਨ ਸ੍ਰਯਾਮਤਾੲੀ ਕੈ
transliteration: Roopo Kaansee Dono Jaisay Oojal Baran Hota , Kaajar Au Choaa Hai Samaan Syaamataaee Kai ?
translation: Just as silver and bronze shine alike, collyrium and incense stick ash mixed with oil have the same blackness.

gurmukhi: ੲਿੰਦ੍ਰਾੲਿਨ ਫਲ ਅੰਮ੍ਰਿਤ ਫਲ ਪੀਤ ਸਮ ਹੀਰਾ ਅੌ ਫਟਕ ਸਮ ਰੂਪ ਹੈ ਦਿਖਾੲੀ ਕੈ
transliteration: Indraain Dhal Anmrit Dhal Peet Sama , Heeraa Au Dhatak Sam Roop Hai Dikhaaee Kai ?
translation: Just as colocynth (Tuma) and mango both being yellow look alike, a diamond and a marble bear the same hue.

gurmukhi: ਤੈਸੇ ਖਲ ਦ੍ਰਿਸਟਿ ਮੈਂ ਅਸਾਧ ਸਾਧ ਸਮ ਦੇਹ ਬੂਝਤ ਬਿਬੇਕੀ ਜਲ ਜੁਗਤਿ ਸਮਾੲੀ ਕੈ ॥੫੯੭॥
transliteration: Taisay Khal Drisati Main Asaadh Saadh Sam Dayha , Boojhat Bibaykee Jal Jougati Samaaee Kai ?597?
translation: Similarly, in the eyes of a foolish person, good and bad men are seen the same, but one who is a knowledgeable person with Guru's teachings, knows how to separate milk from water like a swan. He has the ability to distinguish between a saint and a sinner.
